Dear Mr. Rider:
We regret we have been unable to answer your inquiry of Noverrtoer
1^ regarding our acceptance of Package #3 and //b before this time. Even
now we cannot give you a definite answer. However, if satisfactory arrange¬
ments can be made regarding the assessments to be imposed January 1, 1952
we will gladly continue our participation in the NAEB Network functions.
To come directly to the point, we are a part time station broad¬
casting a total of six hours a week (Monday Evenings 6:00 to 12:00 P. M.).
As a result we can use only a small portion of the program material of¬
fered by the network. ” On this basis our hourly cost per programs is con¬
siderably higher than similar class stations.
We feel this situation merits some consideration on your part
and that a fair assessment for our station would be in the neighborhood
of one-sixth the amount charged to a full time station.
Would you please advise us of your views on the matter.
Sincerely,
